intro: Adambea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy Adambea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive tubular shape. It produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds dispersed by animals.
